questions.text: A 42-year-old man came to the opd with c/o fever, flank pain & urgency to urinate. After investigations, he has been diagnosed with acute bacterial pyelonephritis. Which of the following drug can be given ?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ceftriaxone Ceftriaxone is an antibiotic medicine used to treat bacterial infections in your body. It is effective in infections of the brain, lungs, ear, urinary tract, skin and soft tissues, bones and joints, blood and heart. It is also used to prevent infections during surgery.

Highyeild:

Upper utis (pyelonephritis) require more aggressive & longer treatment. Since pyelonephritis may damage the kidney/ give rise to septicaemia, it may be treated with a potent parenteral antibacterial such as cefuroxime, cefoperazone, ceftriaxone, gentamicin or levofloxacin. The usual duration of treatment is 10–14 days, but longer treatment may be required.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A . Phenazopyridine, a urinary analgesic, is an orange dye which exerts analgesic action in the urinary tract & affords symptomatic relief of burning sensation, dysuria & urgency due to cystitis. It does not have antibacterial properties. Hence it cannot be used in case of bacterial pyelonephritis. Option: B. Nitrofurantoin & option c. Methenamine - are urinary antiseptics, which are orally administered amas which attain antibacterial concentration only in urine not in the kidney, with no systemic antibacterial effect. Hence it won’t be effective in pyelonephritis which involves kidneys.

Extraedge:

Side-effects of drugs Ceftriaxone- cholecystitis Imipenem-seizures Vancomycin- Red man syndrome, mild nephrotoxicity Aminoglycosides- nephrotoxicity & ototoxicity Macrolides- UGI distress Clindamycin- GI distress, diarrhoea Doxycycline- phototoxicity, teeth discoloration Metronidazole- metallic taste, stomatitis,. seizures/encephalopathy with deranged LFT Co-trimoxazole- allergy, photosensitivity, raised Cr Chloramphenicol- BM suppression, Grey baby syndrome

Table:

Treatment of complicated UTI Pyelonephritis Initial treatment should be inpatient If Mild-moderate: Ceftriaxone, Cefepime, Fluoroquinolones, Aztreonam If Severe: Carbapenem, Betalactam/betalactamase inhibitor such as Ampicillin/Sulbactam and Pipercillin/Tazobactam

questions.text: A 52-year-old female came to the opd with c/o burning micturition & excessive pain while passing urine. The doctor advises her to do a urine culture & sensitivity. Before the reports, the doctor wants to start her with an empirical therapy using fluoroquinolones (fqs). The following fqs can be given except:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Moxifloxacin Moxifloxacin is the most potent fq against m. Tuberculosis & is extensively used in mdr-tb. It is primarily used for pneumonia, bronchitis, sinusitis, and otitis media, in which efficacy is comparable to β-lactam antibiotics. Because of bile excretion, urinary concentrations are low & hence it is not used for utis.

Highyeild:

Moxifloxacin has a high activity against most respiratory pathogens. Moxifloxacin has been shown to be effective against Gram+ve, Gram-ve, and atypical strains, as well as multi-drug resistant Streptococcus pneumoniae. Moxifloxacin is effective in controlled studies of community-acquired pneumonia, exacerbations of chronic bronchitis and acute bacterial rhinosinusitis.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A . Norfloxacin is primarily used for utis. Given for 8–12 weeks, it can treat chronic uti. It is also good for bacterial diarrhoea because high concentrations are present in the gut & anaerobic flora of the gut is not disturbed. Option: B. Levofloxacin is indicated in sinusitis, pyelonephritis, prostatitis, other uti, community-acquired pneumonia, exacerbations of chronic bronchitis as well as skin/soft tissue infections. It is an alternative drug for chlamydial urethritis. It is the second most active fq for tb. It is a component of the standardized regimen for mdr in India. Option: C . Ciprofloxacin is the most potent first-generation fq. It is highly effective in utis because of its potent action against gram-negative bacilli.

questions.text: A 42-year-old male came to the opd with c/o burning micturition & excessive pain while passing urine. The doctor prescribes him with the drug nitrofurantoin. The mechanism of action of this drug is by:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

DNA damage Nitrofurantoin causes damage to the DNA of cultured diploid human fibroblasts. As a consequence DNA synthesis is blocked. The damage is removed by the normal enzymatic DNA repair system. Xeroderma pigmentosum fibroblasts which are defective in the excision endonuclease fail to repair nitrofurantoin-caused lesions.

Highyeild:

Mechanism of action of nitrofurantoin: susceptible bacteria enzymatically reduce nitrofurantoin to generate reactive intermediates which damage DNA & affect protein synthesis. It is primarily bacteriostatic but may be cidal at higher concentrations and in acidic urine because its activity is enhanced at lower ph.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A . Cell wall synthesis inhibitor : the drugs acting by this mechanism are: penicillins, cephalosporins, carbapenems, monobactams, vancomycin, cycloserine, and bacitracin. Option: C . Urinary analgesic : phenazopyridine, an orange dye which exerts analgesic action in the urinary tract & affords symptomatic relief of burning sensation, dysuria & urgency due to cystitis. It does not have antibacterial properties. Option: D. Cell membrane leakage : the drugs acting by this mechanism are: polymyxin , colistin , bacitracin, and amphotericin b.

Extraedge:

UTI antibiotics in pregnancy Recommended Contraindicated Nitrofurantoin Amoxicillin Tetracyclines Amoxicillin-clavulanate Fluoroquinolones Cephalexin Trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole

questions.text: A 48-year-old male, with a known case of gout under medication probenecid, came to the opd with c/o fever, painful & burning micturition. Nitrofurantoin should not be given in this case because :

options.label: A
options.text: Nitrofurantoin inhibits tubular secretion of probenecid

options.label: B
options.text: Probenecid inhibits tubular secretion of nitrofurantoin

options.label: D
options.text: Probenecid inhibits the metabolism of nitrofurantoin

questions.correct_answer: B. Probenecid inhibits tubular secretion of nitrofurantoin
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Probenecid inhibits tubular secretion of nitrofurantoin

Highyeild:

Probenecid inhibits tubular secretion of nitrofurantoin & reduces the concentration of nitrofurantoin attained in urine. Hence it may interfere with its urinary antiseptic action & should not be combined. Probenecid is commonly prescribed with penicillin to prolong its half-lives.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A . Nitrofurantoin inhibits tubular secretion of probenecid, option c. Nitrofurantoin inhibits metabolism of probenecid & option d. Probenecid inhibits the metabolism of nitrofurantoin is the wrong option. These 2 drugs don’t have any metabolism type of interactions.

Extraedge:

Nitrofurantoin (urinary antiseptic) Primarily bacteriostatic. Cidal at higher conc; Activity more at acidic urine Mechanism - bacterial enzymatic reduction to reactive intermediate - DNA damage Gm (-) ve organisms – E.coli; No cross resistance Probenecid - inhibit tubular secretion – reduces activity Antagonizes action of nalidixic acid

Table:

Competition: Probenecid (Benuryl) - Uricosuric Dosage: 500 mg BID to 500 mg QID Side Effects: Headache, anorexia, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal discomfort, skin rash, flushing, drug fever, anaphylaxis, increased urination, sore gums, dizziness, hemolytic anemia, and aplastic anemia Significant drug-drug interactions: methotrexate, indomethacin, ketorolac, zidovudine, dyphylline, nitrofurantoin, doripenem, zalcitabine, amoxicillin, cefditoren pivoxil, cefpodoxime proxetil, cefprozil, choline salicylate, enprofylline, ertapenem, gatifloxacin, ketorolac, lorazepam, norfloxacin, phenprocoumon, piretanide, tenofovir, zidovudine and zomepirac Probenecid inhibits multiple transporters of the MRP, OATP and organic anion transporter families (potent inhibition of OAT1 and OAT3 associated with the large number of drug-drug interactions) Interactions at URAT1 not thought to contribute to interactions

questions.text: A 28-year-old pregnant female came to the opd with c/o fever and painful & burning micturition. Nitrofurantoin has been given to this pregnant lady. The following adverse effects can be seen except :
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Chemical cystitis Chemical cystitis & hematuria are seen with high doses of urinary antiseptic, methenamine given for long periods (not with nitrofurantoin).

Highyeild:

Adverse effects of nitrofurantoin: Gi intolerance—nausea, epigastric pain & diarrhoea (option c). An acute reaction with chills, fever & leucopenia occurs occasionally. Peripheral neuritis & other neurological effects are reported with long-term use.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A .Hemolytic anaemia is rare, except in g-6-pd deficiency Option: B. The urine of patients taking nitrofurantoin turns dark brown on exposure to air.

Extraedge:

Clinical presentation of cystitis: - All forms of cystitis are characterized by a triad of symptoms: Frequency, which in acute cases may necessitate urination every 15 to 20 minutes. Lower abdominal pain localized over the bladder region or in the suprapubic region. Dysuria: pain or burning on urination.

questions.text: A 26-year-old pregnant lady came to the opd with c/o lower abdominal pain, burning micturition & dysuria. After investigations, she has been diagnosed with uti. The following drugs can be given except :
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Norfloxacin Levofloxacin is an antibiotic, used in the treatment of bacterial infections in adults and children (;6 months age). It is also used in treating infections of the urinary tract, nose, throat, skin and lungs (pneumonia). It cures the infection by stopping the further growth of the causative microorganisms.

Highyeild:

Traveler's diarrhea ETEC most common Mild,non dysentery,single dose of ciprofloxacin 750 mg PO combination with loperamide High fever,bloody stools,typical invasive picture, norfloxacin 400 mg bid or ciprofloxacin 500 mg for 3 day

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A . Amoxiclav & option c. Cephalexin - are beta-lactam antibiotics which are safer in pregnancy. Hence it can be given. Amoxiclav is the drug of choice for uti in pregnancy. Option: B. Ceftriaxone- is also safer in pregnancy & it is indicated in complicated uti during pregnancy.

Extraedge:

Fluoroquinolones (FQs) Ciprofloxacin: po/iv/topical Norfloxacin: po only Levofloxacin: po/iv - May have on MTC donation list Rapidly Bactericidal Concentration-dependent Spectrum of Activity: Gram negatives: active against nearly all Cipro, Levo are most active FQs against Pseudomonas Gram-positives: Streptococci, Staphylococci, Enterococci (+/-), Bacillus anthracis Limited activity vs. MRSA Anaerobes Atypical bacteria Mycobacteria (including tuberculosis)
